title: Full benchmarks
body:
*Original issue*: https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/200

We can now do some first benchmarks for a full compilation to object files using the `parse2` benchmark:
```
$ time lfortran --no-color --show-ast bench.f90 > b-ast.log
real	0m0.068s
user	0m0.050s
sys	0m0.013s
$ time lfortran --no-color --show-asr bench.f90 > b-asr.log
real	0m0.152s
user	0m0.119s
sys	0m0.028s
$ time lfortran --no-color --pass=do_loops --show-asr bench.f90 > b-asr2.log
real	0m0.192s
user	0m0.154s
sys	0m0.033s
$ time lfortran --show-llvm bench.f90 > b-llvm.log
real	0m0.318s
user	0m0.263s
sys	0m0.048s
$ time lfortran -c bench.f90 -o b.o
real	0m7.338s
user	0m7.194s
sys	0m0.107s
$ time gfortran -c bench.f90 -o b.o
real	0m8.980s
user	0m8.584s
sys	0m0.322s
```
So LFortran can generate (and print) LLVM IR in 0.3s. LLVM then takes 7s to compile it, for total of 7.3s. GFortran takes 8.9s total.
